questions.text: What is the 1% rule in real estate investing?
options: Property should cost 1% of your net worth
Monthly rent should be at least 1% of purchase price
questions.explanation: The 1% rule suggests monthly rent should equal at least 1% of the property's purchase price for positive cash flow.

questions.text: What is cash flow in real estate?
questions.explanation: Cash flow is the net income after subtracting all expenses from rental income.

questions.text: What is appreciation in real estate?
questions.explanation: Appreciation is the increase in property value over time, building equity.
Capitalization rate (cap rate) measures the expected rate of return on a real estate investment.
BRRRR stands for Buy, Renovate, Rent, Refinance, Repeat - a popular real estate investment strategy.
